episode_title: 705 - The One With The Engagement Picture

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica and Phoebe are going through a bunch of pictures as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Someone on the subway licked my neck! Licked my neck!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh Willie’s still alive!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you guys doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, my mom called, they’re gonna run our engagement announcement in the local paper, so we’re looking for a good picture of us.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oooh, I’m afraid that does not exist.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s not true, there are great pictures of us!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, there are great pictures of you standing next to a guy who’s going like this… (Makes what can only be described as a toothy frown. Henceforth, this shall be known as The Face.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! That’s the creep that you’re with at the Statue of Liberty .

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know what it is, I just can’t take a good picture.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, here’s a great one.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’m not in that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know, but look at me: all tan.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, why don’t you guys go get portraits done by a professional photographer.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s a good idea! I bet they have one of those wind machines! Y’know… (Does the whole hair blowing in the wind model type poses.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah that’s great! Next to that, Chandler won’t look so stupid.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler what do you say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, but I should warn you, I’m not going. I’m going. (Does The Face while saying that last part.)

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is sitting on the couch as Ross and Chandler enter after playing basketball.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude, that reverse lay-up! Oh…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How about those three-pointers?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Amazing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And those guys were this (Doing the standard “This Close” gesture) close to lettin’ us play this time too.
(They both get dejected and go sit down.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey look-look, Phoebe’s talking to uh, Cute Coffeehouse Guy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you guys call him Cute Coffeehouse Guy? We call him Hums While He Pees.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, and we call Ross Lingers In The Bathroom.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey you guys, Hums While He Pees just asked me out!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, I thought that guy was married.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He is! But he’s getting divorced—Ross! Maybe you know him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s not a club.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, if this guy’s going through a divorce, is it such a good idea to start going out with him?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, divorced men are not bad men!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They have that on the napkins at the club.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I gotta get back to work.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You don’t have to be back for a half-hour!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah but, my assistant Tag does sit-ups in the office during lunch. Ohh! I could just spread him on a cracker.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Rach, if you have a crush on this guy, why would you hire him? I mean y’know you can’t date him right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, I know that. I know that. Although, we made a joke that we spend so much time together he should call me his work wife.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Soon he’ll be able to call you, that lady he knew who got fired.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I am not gonna get fired, because I’m not gonna act on it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So you wouldn’t mind if he was dating someone else?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why? Is he? He is! Isn’t he? He’s dating that slut in marketing!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Maybe I should open a divorced men’s club.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Dude that is so sad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I could put uh-uh a basketball court in the back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Could I play?

content.description: Rachel’s Outer Office, she’s returning from lunch to see Tag not doing his sit-ups.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, no sit-ups today Tag?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I just did them.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well drop and give me ten more!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, I-I had a drink with lunch. Did those cost reports come in?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Yeah, I filled them out last night?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, great could you make me four copies of those?
(He gets up to make the copies leaving Rachel alone with his stuff. She notices his sweater in his backpack and holds it up to her nose as Melissa, a coworker, walks up.)

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Hey Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahh, hi! Hi! Melissa, what’s up? I’m just uh, about to umm, go out to the store to get some stuff to put in my backpack. Y’know, like dried fruit and granola and stuff. What’s up? (She has put on the backpack.)

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Umm, is Tag here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. Why?

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Oh, I was gonna talk to him about doing something tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?! Got a little crush on Tag there do ya?

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Well, we’ve been flirting back and forth, but I was hoping that tonight it would turn into something a little more than that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, whoa-whoa easy there Melissa! This ain’t a locker room, okay? But, y’know I remember him saying that-that he had plans tonight.

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Oh no!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah. All right, back to work.

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Hey! Isn’t that Tag’s backpack.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah Melissa, I don’t want to be known as the uh, office bitch, but I will call your supervisor.
(Melissa beats a hasty retreat.)

content.description: A Portrait Studio, Chandler and Monica are trying to take their engagement picture. Monica has a beautiful smile, while Chandler hasn’t.

content.speaker: The Photographer
content.text: Great! That’s great Monica! Great! Now, Chandler, you want to give us a smile?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Does The Face.)

content.speaker: The Photographer
content.text: I’m sorry, is the seat uncomfortable?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I am.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, listen to me sweetie, I know you can do this. Okay? You have a beautiful smile.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I do? (He smiles, beautifully.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! (They turn to the camera, and Chandler does The Face again.) All right, maybe you don’t have to smile. Let’s try something else. Let’s try umm, try looking sexy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (You’ll have to see it, I can’t describe the face he makes, but it isn’t good.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Or not.

content.description: Rachel’s Office, Joey is knocking on the door holding a hand over a spot on his shirt.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi Joey! What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, well I’ve got an audition down the street and I spilled sauce all over the front of my shirt. (Removes his hand to reveal a huge sauce stain.) You got an extra one?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, sure. Umm…here. (Hands him one.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great. (He doesn’t like it.) You got anything that’s not Ralph Lauren ?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I don’t think so Joe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I guess this will be fine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, listen umm, what-what are you doing tonight?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nothing, why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How would you feel about taking out my assistant Tag? I’ll pay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh, Rach I got to say it’s gonna take a lot of money for me to go out on a date with a dude.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not asking you to go on a date with him!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really? ‘Cause I could kinda use the money.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, just-just he-he’s new in town and I know he doesn’t have any guy friends. Just take him to like a ball game or something. I’ll really appreciate it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure, no problem. (Sees something.) Ooh—Hey, donuts!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. (He grabs a jelly donut, takes a bite, and guess what he spills all over himself. He tries to clean it up and smears it all over the shirt.)

content.description: A Portrait Studio, Chandler and Monica are still trying to get the picture taken.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know. Let’s try a look…of far off…wonderment. Okay, we’ll-we’ll gaze into our future and we’ll think about our marriage and the days to come. (Chandler is still not getting it.) Chandler! What is the matter with your face?! I mean this picture is supposed to say “Geller and Bing to be married,” not “Local woman saves drowning moron!” (The photographer laughs.) Hey! Don’t laugh at him! He’s my drowning moron!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Aww! (Smiles.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s it! Take it! Take it! Take it!
(Chandler turns to the camera and does The Face.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Ross are going over the picture proofs.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I like this one. (Points to it.) It seems to say, “I love you and that’s why I have to kill you.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They can’t all be bad. (To Chandler) Find the one where you make your bedroom eyes. Ohh, there it is.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God! Those are my bedroom eyes?! Why did you ever sleep with me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you really want to pull at that thread?
(Phoebe enters with Hums While He Pees also known as Kyle.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m having a really good time!

content.speaker: Kyle
content.text: Me too! I’m sorry that guy in the subway licked your neck.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh. No that’s okay, he’s a friend.

content.speaker: Kyle
content.text: Hey uh, I don’t mean to be presumptuous but I have these two tickets to the ballroom dancing finals tomorrow night if you want to go?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I… Well y’know I-I mean I missed the-the semi-finals, so I’d just be lost.

content.speaker: Kyle
content.text: I know it’s really lame, but I got these tickets from my boss and—Oh no! No! No! My God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, don’t freak out. I’ll go.

content.speaker: Kyle
content.text: No it’s… Uh, my ex-wife Whitney is out there. I cannot deal with her right now. That woman is crazy!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I know. Hold on. (She walks over to the couch.) Hey Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, umm that’s Whitney (Points), Kyle’s ex-wife out there, now do you think that you can y’know divert her so that we can slip out?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well okay but I have two tickets to the ballroom dance finals. (She holds up the tickets that Kyle gave her.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I don’t think so Pheebs. (Pause) All right, I’ll do it. But just because you’re a friend. (Grabs the tickets and heads to divert Whitney.)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Ross is dancing around his living room as Phoebe enters, catching and startling him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi Ginger.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right! I want my key back!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t have it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s right there! (Points to her hand.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ugh, okay Sherlock! (Hands over the key.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I’m sorry but you-you-you better go Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, well I just wanted to say thank you though, for diverting Kyle’s ex.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah—No—You’re welcome. We’ll talk about it later.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.
(Ross opens the door to reveal Whitney standing there.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi Whitney.

content.speaker: Whitney
content.text: Hi Ross! You ready for breakfast?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yep. (Phoebe slams the door shut.) Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Kyle’s ex-wife? You were supposed to divert her, not date her!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi! I’m sorry, but can you give me a second while I talk to this woman, who by the way did not spend the night?
content.parenthetical: opens the door and to Whitney

content.speaker: Whitney
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (Closes the door.) (To Phoebe) I did divert her and we ended up having a great time! Okay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Watching ballroom dancing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes! That’s where we realized we were both super cool people!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well look-look, okay Ross, Kyle just told me some really bad stuff about her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Like what?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Like she’s really mean, and she’s over critical, and-and—No! She will paint a room a really bright color without even checking with you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And! She uses sex as a weapon!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine! Thank you for warning me. At breakfast I’ll be on full alert for room painting and sex weapons.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re still gonna go out with her?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, didn’t you just hear what I said?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs come on! I mean, consider the source! Of course her ex-husband’s gonna say that stuff. Now, if you’ll excuse me…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No listen to me! She is crazy !

content.speaker: Whitney
content.text: Uh, your door isn’t sound proof.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You see? Nothing is good enough for her!

content.description: Rachel’s Office, Tag is arriving as Rachel is standing there.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Good morning.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi Tag! Hey, so did you have fun with uh, with Joey last night?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Oh yeah! We went to the Knicks game.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh that’s nice.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Then we went to this bar and he hooked us up with all these women!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wo-women? You mean like old women?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Well kinda old, like 30.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: And I never used to be able to just talk to girls in bars, but I got like 20 phone numbers last night.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s great! Wow man, so Joey must’ve really taught you some stuff huh?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: A little.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?
(A beautiful women walks up.)

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: How you doin’?
content.parenthetical: To her, in the Joey voice

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is teaching Chandler how to smile. Chandler is smiling.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See? That’s a great smile! Easy. Natural. Now, pretend I have a camera. (Chandler immediately does The Face.) You’re changing it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t help it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, all right, all right, all right, you wanna know what I do when I take resume shots?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Borrow money from me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, first—first of all, you want to make it look spontaneous. I look down (Looks down), look down, keep looking down; then I look up. (Looks up and smiles.) See? All right, now you try. Look down (Chandler looks down), you’re looking down, keep looking down…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why is there jelly on your shoe?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I had a donut. (Chandler nods.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So uh, heard you had some fun with Tag last night.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! That guy’s alright!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah and you had fun teaching him how to be all Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, all the women.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey well, you can’t teach someone to be good with women. Y’know, that’s why I never had any luck with Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m right here!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, would-would you mind just not going out with him again? Okay, just the idea of you and he and all these women, it’s just—And I know he’s my assistant and I can’t date him—but it just bothers me, all right?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! No-no-no-no, you can’t take him away from me! I got a great partner to pick up girls with! Finally!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m still right here!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, will you, will you at least tell him how hollow and unsatisfying this dating tons of women thing is!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I just don’t want him to meet anybody until I am over my crush—And I will get over it. It’s-it’s not like I love him, it’s just physical! But—I mean I get crushes like this all the time! I mean hell, I had a crush on you when I first met ya!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know, Monica told me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did you have a crush on me, when you first met me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Sure. (Joey nods his head questioningly and Rachel nods no.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can you people not see me?! (He waves his arms around to get their attention.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, will you talk to him?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know Rach.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on! I’ll give you ten free Ralph Lauren shirts.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: One! (Pause.) No ten! You said ten! You can’t take that back!

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is there as Tag enters carrying a bag.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Hey Joey, you wanted to talk to me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. You uh, you got something for me?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Oh, yeah, this is from Rachel.
(He hands Joey the bag and he quickly counts its contents.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ten. Okay. Now Tag there’s such a thing as too many women.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, for you!

content.description: The Portrait Studio, Monica is waiting for Chandler to make another attempt at taking a good picture.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! There you are!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There I am!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, Joey said I uh, I needed to relax so he gave me an antihistamine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, and then I fell asleep on the subway and went all the way to Brooklyn. Brooklyn is f-far!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, what were you thinking?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know, but don’t worry, don’t worry, because I know how to take a picture now. (They get ready) Okay, see? Look down (Looks down), look down, look down… (He falls asleep.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! (Looks up and does The Face.)

content.description: Central Perk, Ross and Phoebe are there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, how are things going with crazy? Has she cooked your rabbit yet?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Listen, you are hearing one side of the story, okay—and F.Y.I she must’ve shown Kyle over 30 paint samples before she painted that room! And his response to each one was, “I don’t give a tiny rat’s ass.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah well, maybe she should’ve spent a little less time decorating and a little more time in the bedroom.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I don’t think we are gonna have that problem, but maybe that’s just because I am not emotionally unavailable!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You think he’s emotionally unavailable?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think he can be.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, maybe he wouldn’t be if she didn’t bring the office home every night!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, excuse her for knowing what she wants to do with her life!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah well, she certainly knew what she was doing New Year’s Eve 1997.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I knew you were gonna throw that in my face!! That was three years ago! She apologized and she apologized! What more do you want?!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We want the last six years back!!
content.parenthetical: gets up and starts to leave

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So do we!! So do we!! (Ross notices a couple has been staring at them.) I’m sorry you had to see that.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Good morning Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! (He hands her her mail) Thanks, hey so uh what’d you do last night?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Went out with Joey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah? Another night of bird-dogging the chickas?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: No. We had a really good talk. I don’t think I’m gonna do that bar scene anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! I did not see that coming.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: It’s just not really who I am. Y’know, I’ve always been happier when…Why am I telling you this? You don’t care about this stuff.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, yes I do! I do! I mean, come on go on, you were, you were saying I am happier when uh, y’know?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: When I’m in a relationship, I love having a girlfriend.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Someone I can spoil, y’know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sp-spoil?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Uh-huh! Let me ask you something?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Do you believe that there is one perfect person for everyone?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I-I’m startin’ too.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: And if that person is already in your life, you should do something about it right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! Hell yes!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: All right then, it’s settled.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I’m gettin’ back together with my ex-girlfriend.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’d love to!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello?! (Listens) Oh, yeah! (To Tag) This is gonna be a while. Excuse me. (Tag leaves and she closes the door behind him, disgustedly.) Yeah!
content.parenthetical: panics, turns around, picks up the phone, and pretend to talk on it

content.description: Central Perk, Ross and Phoebe are there again, only now they’re not talking to each other. Phoebe is loudly stirring her coffee.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. Is that annoying? And speaking about being selfish in bed, how’s Whitney?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well maybe she wouldn’t have to be selfish in bed if someone else knew where everything was!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh he knows! (Quietly) For the most part.
(Kyle and Whitney enter.)

content.speaker: Kyle
content.text: Oh hey! Good, you’re both here.

content.speaker: Whitney
content.text: We kinda need to talk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Both of you together?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wh-what’s up?

content.speaker: Whitney
content.text: Well, I went over to Kyle’s last night to pick up a few things and we got to reminiscing…

content.speaker: Kyle
content.text: …we talked through most of the night and we realized that the reason we were so angry at each other was because there are still feelings there. So… (Pause)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh just say it Kyle!

content.speaker: Kyle
content.text: We’re gonna give it another try.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What about her whining and her constant need for attention?!

content.speaker: Whitney
content.text: I’m gonna work on that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh right, because you’re so capable of change.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, he hums when he pees!

content.speaker: Whitney
content.text: I do know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It makes him miss the bowl, but whatever.

content.speaker: Whitney
content.text: We’re so sorry. (They get up to leave.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s all right, we-we don’t need you. In fact, hey I’m over it already.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, and y’know what? I don’t give a tiny rat’s ass.

content.speaker: Kyle
content.text: Yeah, we’re gonna go. (They leave.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry. Ugh, Pheebs, you were, you were right about her. Y’know, she did try to use sex as a weapon! Yeah, I hurt my back a little.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Y’know, he hums while he does other stuff to.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, we’re better off without them.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And y’know, even if they break up again, you’d better not let him in your sad men’s club!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Divorced men’s club.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Potato, Potaato. (She’s pronounces potato with the both the short and long As.)

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey are there as Monica enters with the local paper that has the engagement picture in it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey guys check it out! My mom sent me the paper!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, let’s see it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahhh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (She opens it up and shows it to them.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, that looks good.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys make a very attractive couple. (The camera cuts to a shot of the picture and we see that Monica is posing with Joey instead of Chandler.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, we look great together.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, we really do!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! Imagine what our kids would look like!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know, we don’t have to imagine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m marrying her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We’ll just see.
